It mandates that executive agencies comply with fuel use prohibitions and pollution control standards outlined in the Act. It also emphasizes inter-agency coordination with the Department of Energy and requires agencies to develop plans for fuel use conversion. The order doesn't directly address immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. It leans towards government intervention in the economy by enforcing fuel use regulations. It centralizes authority by tasking the Secretary of Energy with providing guidance and the OMB with overseeing agency plans.
